careerBank.description: Develops, tests, and maintains software applications and systems to meet user needs.
careerBank.dayInTheLife: A typical day involves writing code, collaborating with team members on features, debugging issues, and attending stand-up meetings to discuss progress.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Suitable for late students (taster projects), grads and pros (upskilling/advanced roles).

careerBank.description: Provides and coordinates patient care, educates patients and the public about various health conditions.
careerBank.dayInTheLife: A day can include assessing patients' conditions, administering medications, recording observations in medical records, and collaborating with doctors.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Good early-career clinical roles and longer-career progression.

careerBank.description: Analyzes complex data to extract meaningful insights and help organizations make data-driven decisions.
careerBank.educationPath: Master's or PhD in Data Science or related field
careerBank.dayInTheLife: Work involves collecting and cleaning large datasets, building predictive models, and presenting findings to stakeholders through reports and visualizations.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Mostly for grads and pros; students can view as long-term target.

careerBank.description: Creates visual concepts, using computer software or by hand, to communicate ideas that inspire, inform, and captivate consumers.
careerBank.dayInTheLife: A day includes brainstorming with clients, sketching out ideas, using design software to create visuals, and revising work based on feedback.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Portfolios matter; good for students (internships) and pros (freelance/lead roles).

careerBank.description: Designs, develops, builds, and tests mechanical and thermal sensors and devices, including tools, engines, and machines.
careerBank.dayInTheLife: Activities often include developing and testing prototypes, analyzing data, creating technical drawings, and managing projects.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Strong fit for students who enjoy hands-on builds and grads entering engineering roles.

careerBank.description: Educates students in a specific subject at the secondary level, preparing them for college and future careers.
careerBank.educationPath: Bachelor's in Education and Teaching License
careerBank.dayInTheLife: A day consists of delivering lessons, grading assignments, communicating with parents, and providing extra help to students.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Students see teaching as a career path; grads/ pros for career-switch.

careerBank.description: Examines, analyzes, and interprets accounting records to prepare financial statements, give advice, or audit and evaluate statements prepared by others.
careerBank.dayInTheLife: Daily tasks include reconciling bank statements, preparing tax returns, and ensuring compliance with financial regulations.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Primarily for grads & pros; students may explore entry-level internships.

careerBank.description: Plans and oversees marketing campaigns to promote a company's brand, products, or services.
careerBank.dayInTheLife: A typical day involves analyzing market trends, managing a marketing team, setting budgets, and collaborating with sales and product teams.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Good advanced career for graduates and professionals.

careerBank.description: Installs, maintains, and repairs electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures. Ensures that work is in accordance with relevant codes.
careerBank.dayInTheLife: A day can involve installing wiring in new buildings, troubleshooting electrical problems, or repairing outdated systems.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Vocational route â€” great for students looking for early earning.

careerBank.description: Oversees the daily food preparation at restaurants and other places where food is served. Directs kitchen staff and handles any food-related concerns.
careerBank.dayInTheLife: A day in the life of a chef includes planning menus, managing kitchen staff, ordering supplies, and ensuring food quality and presentation.
careerBank.audienceNotes: Strong vocational path with apprenticeship options.

student.question: Which of these activities sounds most interesting to you?

Building things.message: Careers in Technology or Engineering may suit you.

Helping people.message: Roles in Healthcare or Education could be a good fit.

Analyzing data.message: Consider careers that emphasise numbers and logic.

Creating art.message: Explore creative roles such as graphic design or media.

student.question: What kind of school projects excite you most?

Science fair builds.message: You might enjoy hands-on engineering or research tracks.

Group presentations.message: Communication and teamwork strengths â€” consider business or education.

Art exhibitions.message: Creative arts paths like design or media could fit well.

Code or apps.message: Tech-oriented paths (software, game dev) could be fulfilling.

student.question: How soon do you want to start earning while learning?

Immediately (part-time).message: Consider vocational/trade certificates or part-time roles.

After finishing school.message: Explore internship and entry-level programs post-graduation.

I prefer full-time study.message: Look at UG degree programs and scholarship opportunities.

Iâ€™m not sure.message: Try exploratory quizzes and short taster courses to decide.

student.question: Which subject at school do you enjoy most?

Maths.message: Math skills open doors to engineering, finance, and data.

Biology / Science.message: Biology fits careers in healthcare, lab science, and research.

English / Languages.message: Strong language skills help in communication, law, and media.

Art / Design.message: Consider visual arts, product design, or media production.

student.question: Do you prefer structured guidance or self-directed learning?

Structured (timetables, teachers).message: You may thrive in formal study programs and degree paths.

Self-directed (online, projects).message: Bootcamps and portfolio-driven careers could suit you.

Mix of both.message: Look for blended programmes, internships, and apprenticeships.

Not sure.message: Start with short courses/club projects to discover what works.

student.question: Do you prefer working indoors (office/lab) or outdoors (field/site)?

Indoors (office/lab).message: Good fit for controlled environments like labs, offices, and digital work.

Outdoors (field/site).message: Explore construction, environmental science, or field engineering roles.

Mix of both.message: Many roles offer a blend, such as project management or consulting.

It doesn't matter.message: Focus on skill development first, environment second.

student.question: When facing a tough problem, you usually...
options: Break it down into smaller steps

Ask for help immediately.message: Strong teamwork and communication are your assets; look for collaborative roles.

Research solutions online.message: You're self-reliant and curious; great for research and technical fields.

Trial and error until fixed.message: Hands-on, experimental approach; suited for engineering, trades, and design.

Break it down into smaller steps.message: Methodical and analytical; excellent for coding, finance, and project planning.

student.question: If you had $100 for a project, what would you spend it on?

Tools/materials.message: A practical, hands-on focus; consider vocational training and trades.

A course/book for skills.message: You value personal growth; explore specialized learning paths.

followUpResources.title: Top Tech Skills to Learn Now

Hiring help.message: Shows leadership and delegation potential; suited for future management or team lead roles.

Marketing/promotion.message: You have a commercial mindset; good for sales, marketing, and entrepreneurship.

student.question: How do you feel about routine tasks vs. constantly changing work?
options: A balance of both is ideal

I like a predictable routine.message: Suits roles requiring high accuracy and structure, like compliance or accounting.

I prefer constant variety.message: You thrive on dynamic challenges; great for project-based roles or creative fields.

A balance of both is ideal.message: A mixed environmentâ€”look at roles in operations, logistics, or clinical settings.

I get bored easily.message: You need fast-paced, high-engagement work like tech support or events.

Achieving a high grade.message: Value recognition and structure; pursue academic or formally accredited paths.

Making a difference for someone.message: Driven by purpose; great for NGO, public sector, or social work roles.

Building something cool/new.message: You're an innovator; suited for product, R&D, and engineering roles.

Earning money.message: A practical goal; explore high-demand trade skills or business roles.

graduate.question: What's your immediate goal after graduation?

Get a full-time job.message: Focus on resume polish, placement drives and graduate roles.

Pursue further studies.message: Look into PG programs, funding, and SOP/CV preparation.

Intern / apprenticeship.message: Internships can be a gateway to full-time roles.

Start a business.message: Explore entrepreneurship programs and startup incubators.

graduate.question: Which skill would you most like to improve before job hunting?

Coding / Technical.message: Consider coding bootcamps and project-based portfolios.

Communication / Public speaking.message: Join presentation clubs, internship interviews and workshops.

Data analysis.message: Short data courses and portfolio projects will help.

Project management.message: Certifications and internships that expose you to workflows help.

graduate.question: What kind of employer do you prefer?

Large corporate.message: Structured graduate programs and stability are common here.

Fast-paced startup.message: Expect diverse tasks and fast learning; portfolio & initiative matter.

followUpResources.title: Joining a Startup: What to Expect

NGO / Public sector.message: Roles may value domain knowledge and mission alignment.

Small-to-medium business.message: Multitasking roles and broader exposureâ€”great for rapid skill building.

graduate.question: How do you prefer to apply for opportunities?

Campus placements.message: Prepare for aptitude tests, company-specific interviews and CV shortlisting.

Direct company applications.message: Tailored CVs and cover letters work best for direct applications.

Referral / network.message: Networking can significantly increase interview chances.

Freelance platforms.message: Build a strong profile and portfolio for short-term gigs.

graduate.question: Which project work do you prefer for your portfolio?

Long-term research.message: Suitable if you aim for research or PG study.

Team product builds.message: Great for product/engineering rolesâ€”shows collaboration and delivery.

Creative showcases.message: A portfolio of finished creative work helps land design/media roles.

graduate.question: Which type of compensation is most appealing to you right now?

High base salary.message: You value certainty and immediate financial stability; focus on established industries/companies.

Stock options/Equity.message: You have a risk-reward mindset; great for startup or high-growth tech roles.

Performance bonuses.message: You are driven by measurable outcomes; suited for sales or consulting.

Comprehensive benefits.message: You prioritize long-term security; look at public sector or large established firms.

graduate.question: How important is company mission/ethics to you when choosing an employer?
options: Not a top priority, only financial matters

Crucial (must align with my values).message: Focus on non-profit, social enterprise, or B-Corp companies.

Important but negotiable.message: You're flexible; seek firms with good CSR reports and competitive pay.

Not a top priority, only financial matte.message: Target high-paying sectors like finance, certain tech areas, or aggressive startups.

graduate.question: Would you prefer to relocate for a dream job?
options: Yes, but only to major cities
No, I want to stay local

Yes, anywhere.message: Open to global opportunities; look for multinational firms and remote contracts.

Yes, but only to major cities.message: Focus job search on hubs for technology, finance, or media.

No, I want to stay local.message: Target local SMBs, public sector, or fully remote companies.

Not sure yet.message: Prioritize remote-first roles to keep options open.

graduate.question: In a team, are you usually the one who...

Sets the direction (vision).message: You are a natural leader; pursue management trainee or product roles.

Manages the schedule (organizer).message: You're detail-oriented and organized; excellent for project management or operations.

Does the detailed execution (specialist).message: You thrive as a technical expert; focus on specialization and deep skill sets.

Solves conflicts (mediator).message: You have strong interpersonal skills; consider HR, client relations, or legal paths.

graduate.question: How do you feel about working overtime or on weekends?
options: I accept it if compensated well
I do it when the project needs it

I avoid it strictly.message: Prioritize roles in public administration, non-profits, or highly regulated corporate environments.

followUpResources.title: Finding Roles with Strict Work Hours

I accept it if compensated well.message: You align effort with financial reward; look at consulting, finance, and high-demand tech.

I do it when the project needs it.message: You're project-focused; great for product delivery, engineering, and startup roles.

I prefer a 9-5 structure.message: Seek structured corporate or public sector positions with defined boundaries.

professional.question: Why are you considering a career change now?

Growth & promotion.message: Focus on upskilling, certification and internal mobility strategies.

Better work-life balance.message: Explore roles with flexible policies or remote-friendly companies.

Higher pay.message: Map skills to market demand and negotiate with evidence of impact.

To follow passion.message: Plan a staged transitionâ€”side projects, part-time training and networking.

professional.question: Which skill would add the most value to your CV right now?

Advanced data skills / ML.message: High ROI for data-heavy roles; consider certification + projects.

Product management.message: Great for moving toward cross-functional leadership roles.

Cloud / DevOps.message: Cloud certifications paired with deployments boost technical leadership hires.

Leadership & people management.message: Leadership training and documented impact enable manager-level moves.

Immediate (1â€“3 months).message: Target internal moves or roles that value transferrable skills; expect faster interviews.

Short-term (3â€“6 months).message: Use focused certifications and networking to change roles.

Medium (6â€“12 months).message: Plan for certifications plus a portfolio of transition projects.

Long-term (12+ months).message: A full career pivotâ€”consider formal education or deep reskilling.

professional.question: Which outcome is most important when negotiating a new role?

Higher base salary.message: Benchmark market salaries and prepare a negotiation script with evidence.

Better title / seniority.message: Titles matter for future mobilityâ€”align responsibilities with requested title.

Flexible hours / remote.message: Negotiate clear policies and outputs/OKRs to secure flexibility.

Clear career growth path.message: Ask for milestones and promotion timelines; capture them in writing if possible.

professional.question: Which evidence best demonstrates your readiness for a higher role?

Quantified impact (metrics).message: Numbers are persuasiveâ€”collect KPIs and measurable outcomes.

Led a cross-functional project.message: Cross-functional leadership indicates readiness for product/ops leadership.

Built a product/feature end-to-end.message: Product delivery experience supports senior product and engineering roles.

Managed & grown a team.message: Direct people management experience is crucial for management positions.

professional.question: Which career risk are you most willing to take right now?
options: Moving to an entirely new industry
Taking a pay cut for a Director-level title
Moving from specialist to general management

Starting a self-funded venture.message: You embrace high risk for high reward; focus on building a robust business plan.

Moving to an entirely new industry.message: You value change and new challenges; highlight transferrable skills and domain learning capacity.

Taking a pay cut for a Director-level ti.message: You prioritize long-term seniority and influence; focus on networking with executive recruiters.

Moving from specialist to general manage.message: You're aiming for broader impact; focus on communication and P&L skills.

professional.question: What defines success for you in your next major role?
options: Mentoring the next generation of talent

Leading a multi-million dollar P&L.message: You are financially driven; target executive roles with budgetary control and accountability.

Mentoring the next generation of talent.message: Your focus is on culture and people development; pursue HR or leadership coaching roles.

Solving a complex technical/research pro.message: You are a technical mastermind; aim for Principal/Distinguished Engineer or Chief Scientist roles.

followUpResources.title: The Role of a Principal Engineer

Creating significant social impact.message: You're mission-driven; look at high-level roles in public policy or non-profit strategy.

professional.question: How do you typically resolve cross-departmental conflicts?

Escalating to senior leadership.message: You prefer clear authority; suited for roles with well-defined hierarchies like legal or compliance.

Data-driven presentation of facts.message: You are analytical and objective; excellent for strategy, finance, and data science leadership.

Consensus-building meetings.message: You're a diplomat; strong fit for HR, PR, or cross-functional Program Management.

Designing a new policy/process.message: You focus on scalable, long-term solutions; ideal for Operations or Engineering leadership.

professional.question: Which factor is most likely to make you leave your current company?

Lack of strategic vision.message: You need to be part of the big picture; target high-growth companies or strategy roles.

Stagnant compensation/benefits.message: Your priority is economic value; leverage market data when seeking new roles.

Toxic work environment.message: You prioritize culture and well-being; seek certified 'best place to work' companies.

Limited opportunity for senior influence.message: You seek impact and authority; focus on Director-level roles and above.

professional.question: What is your biggest challenge in delegating tasks to your team?
options: Worrying it won't be done right
Fear of losing control of the outcome

Worrying it won't be done right.message: You may be a perfectionist; focus on structured process documentation and QA protocols.

Lack of capable direct reports.message: Prioritize talent acquisition and team development in your next role.

Finding the time to teach/train.message: You need to automate or delegate training; focus on enabling manager-of-managers roles.

Fear of losing control of the outcome.message: Work on empowering subordinates and defining clear boundaries. Trust is key for senior roles.

videos.title: A Day in the Life of a Software Engineer
videos.transcript: This video shows a typical day for a software engineer, including stand-up meetings, coding sessions, and pair programming.

videos.title: Choosing the Right University Major
videos.transcript: In this video, guidance counselors explain how to align your strengths and interests with university majors.

videos.transcript: Career coaches share strategies for professionals planning a shift into a new industry.

videos.title: Creative Careers in Design
videos.transcript: Design experts discuss opportunities in graphic design, UI/UX, and animation.

videos.title: Finance Careers Explained
videos.transcript: This video explores different finance roles such as investment analyst, accountant, and financial advisor.

podcasts.title: The Future of Healthcare
podcasts.transcript: In this podcast, we discuss emerging trends in healthcare and opportunities for aspiring medical professionals.

podcasts.title: Building Your First Tech Startup
podcasts.transcript: This episode features young entrepreneurs who turned their ideas into successful startups.

podcasts.title: Leadership in the Modern Workplace
podcasts.transcript: We talk about the evolving role of leaders and how professionals can prepare for management roles.

podcasts.title: The Importance of Networking
podcasts.transcript: Industry experts share tips on building a strong professional network right after graduation.

podcasts.title: Creativity and Innovation
podcasts.transcript: Artists and creators discuss how to stay inspired and turn ideas into real projects.

articles.description: A comprehensive guide with tips and common questions for tech interviews.

articles.title: The Art of Networking: A Guide for Professionals

ebooks.title: The Ultimate Guide to Career Planning
ebooks.description: A deep dive into setting career goals and creating a roadmap for success.

ebooks.title: Switching Lanes: A Handbook for Career Changers
ebooks.description: Practical advice for those looking to transition into a new industry.

webinars.title: Mastering Job Interviews
webinars.description: Join industry experts as they share secrets to succeeding in interviews.

webinars.title: Networking for Career Growth

successStories.name: Jane Doe
successStories.story: Jane started her own business after years of working in tech and now mentors young founders.

successStories.name: Carlos Rivera
successStories.story: Carlos transitioned from teaching to software engineering after completing an online bootcamp and now works at a leading tech company.

successStories.name: Priya Singh
successStories.story: Priya leveraged her background in mathematics to become a data scientist and now leads analytics projects in healthcare.

successStories.name: Michael Dave
successStories.story: Michael turned his passion for art into a successful freelance graphic design business, working with global brands.

successStories.name: Aisha Patel
successStories.story: Aisha found her calling in nursing, helping patients recover and supporting families through difficult times. She now leads a team at a major hospital.

successStories.name: David Adeleke
successStories.story: David's curiosity for how things work led him to engineering. He now designs eco-friendly vehicles and mentors young engineers.

successStories.name: Fatima Al-Sayed
successStories.story: Fatima started as a marketing intern and rose to lead global campaigns for a tech startup, inspiring others with her creativity and leadership.

successStories.name: Liam O'Connor
successStories.story: Liam's passion for teaching has impacted hundreds of students. He now develops innovative curricula and trains new teachers.

successStories.name: Sophia Rossi
successStories.story: Sophia turned her love for numbers into a successful accounting career, helping small businesses thrive and mentoring young professionals.
